item.title: Report I-2025030047
item.description:
Report I-2025030047

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: Overland
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver started to fill the tank and noticed the gages were not moving. The tank overflowed about 15 gallons of sodium hydroxide coming out the tank vent. Spill was cleaned up by the driver and the customer together. Tank has been placed on safety hold and a work order is in the system. No exposures or injuries.

item.title: Report X-2025031066
item.description:
Report X-2025031066

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-14
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 17:30 THE SUPERVISOR FROM THE HUB SECONDARY CALLED THE DMP CAGE TO REPORT A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE ON THE SLIDE. A RESPONDER DONNING PROPER PPE RETRIEVED A SPILL CART AND APPROACHED THE PACKAGE. UPON ARRIVAL THE RESPONDER NOTICED THE CORNER OF THE BOX TO BE WET. AFTER REFERRRING TO THE DECISION TREE AND ACTING ACCORDINGLY THE SPILL WAS CLEANED UP AND THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO THE WASTE DISPOSAL FLOW CHART.

item.title: Report E-2025030325
item.description:
Report E-2025030325

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-21
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2030 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSL (old). It was reported that approximately 2.5 gallons of Paint Thinner was released from a 5-gallon metal can due to a forklift puncture by terminal XSL (old). The release impacted trailer #3159769. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Need BOL to be emailed by caller. Called Chemtrec and spoke to Alan. Report #2025022100179.

item.title: Report E-2025030254
item.description:
Report E-2025030254

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2208 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSL (old). It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of Carboline Carbocoat 8239 was released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by the shipper. The release impacted trailer # 4335144 ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Call Emergency reporting number once BOL is received. This is DOT 5800 reportable. BOL to be emailed. Called Chemtrec and spoke to Matt.
